definitions: the process of taking in and fully understanding information or ideas

examples.text: the assimilation of the knowledge of the Greeks

shortDefinitions: process of taking in and fully understanding information or ideas

definitions: the absorption and integration of people, ideas, or culture into a wider society or culture

examples.text: the assimilation of Italians into American society

shortDefinitions: absorption and integration of people, ideas, or culture into wider society or culture

definitions: the absorption and digestion of food or nutrients by the body or any biological system

examples.text: nitrate assimilation usually takes place in leaves

shortDefinitions: absorption and digestion of food or nutrients by the body or any biological system

definitions: the process of becoming similar to something

examples.text: Watson was ready to work for the assimilation of Scots law to English law where he thought it was justified

shortDefinitions: process of becoming similar to something

definitions: the fact of a sound being made more like another in the same or next word

examples.text: when p is preceded by some Latin prefixes, it is doubled because of the assimilation of a consonant, as in 'apparent' (ad-parent)
there are many assimilations and elisions of consonants and vowels

shortDefinitions: fact of sound being made more like another in same or next word
